description.para: This methods are used to load the structure of your model.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &modelString, const std::string &filetype="urdf", const std::vector< std::string > &packageDirs={})
memberdef.name: loadModelFromString

briefdescription.para: Load the model of the robot from a string.

parameterdescription.para: string containg the model of the robot.
type of the file to load, currently supporting only urdf type
a vector containing the different directories where to search for model meshes

simplesect.para: In case no package is specified ModelLoader will look for the meshes in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, ROS_PACKAGE_PATH and AMENT_PREFIX_PATH

If a given model searches for the meshes in package://StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, and the actual mesh is in /usr/local/share/StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, packageDirs should contain /usr/local/share.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &filename, const std::string &filetype="urdf", const std::vector< std::string > &packageDirs={})
memberdef.name: loadModelFromFile

briefdescription.para: Load the model of the robot from an external file.

parameterdescription.para: path to the file to load
type of the file to load, currently supporting only urdf type.
a vector containing the different directories where to search for model meshes

simplesect.para: In case no package is specified ModelLoader will look for the meshes in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, ROS_PACKAGE_PATH and AMENT_PREFIX_PATH

If a given model searches for the meshes in package://StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, and the actual mesh is in /usr/local/share/StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, packageDirs should contain /usr/local/share.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Model &fullModel, const std::vector< std::string > &consideredJoints, const std::string filetype="")
memberdef.name: loadReducedModelFromFullModel

briefdescription.para: Load reduced model from another model, specifyng only the desired joints in the model.

detaileddescription.para: All other joints will be considered to be fixed to their default position, and their child links will be lumped together.

simplesect.para: the order of the degreese of freedom of the newly loaded model will be the one specified by the input joints serialization, i.e. consideredJoints

parameterdescription.para: path to the file to load.
list of joints to consider in the model.
(optional) explicit definition of the type of the loaded file. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.

simplesect.para: true if all went well (files were correctly loaded and consistent), false otherwise.
Until https://github.com/robotology/idyntree/issues/132 is fixed, this method does not accounts for sensors.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string modelString, const std::vector< std::string > &consideredJoints, const std::string filetype="", const std::vector< std::string > &packageDirs={})
memberdef.name: loadReducedModelFromString

briefdescription.para: Load reduced model from string, specifyng only the desired joints in the model.

detaileddescription.para: All other joints will be considered to be fixed to their default position, and their child links will be lumped together.

parameterdescription.para: string containg the model of the robot.
list of joints to consider in the model.
(optional) explicit definiton of the filetype to load. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.
(optional) a vector containing the different directories where to search for model meshes

simplesect.para: true if all went well (files were correctly loaded and consistent), false otherwise.
In case no package is specified ModelLoader will look for the meshes in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, ROS_PACKAGE_PATH and AMENT_PREFIX_PATH

If a given model searches for the meshes in package://StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, and the actual mesh is in /usr/local/share/StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, packageDirs should contain /usr/local/share.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string filename, const std::vector< std::string > &consideredJoints, const std::string filetype="", const std::vector< std::string > &packageDirs={})
memberdef.name: loadReducedModelFromFile

briefdescription.para: Load reduced model from file, specifyng only the desired joints in the model.

detaileddescription.para: All other joints will be considered to be fixed to their default position, and their child links will be lumped together.

parameterdescription.para: path to the file to load.
list of joints to consider in the model.
(optional) explicit definiton of the filetype to load. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.
(optional) a vector containing the different directories where to search for model meshes

simplesect.para: true if all went well (files were correctly loaded and consistent), false otherwise.
In case no package is specified ModelLoader will look for the meshes in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, ROS_PACKAGE_PATH and AMENT_PREFIX_PATH

If a given model searches for the meshes in package://StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, and the actual mesh is in /usr/local/share/StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, packageDirs should contain /usr/local/share.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Model &fullModel, const std::vector< std::string > &consideredJoints, const std::unordered_map< std::string, std::vector< double >> &removedJointPositions, const std::string filetype="")
memberdef.name: loadReducedModelFromFullModel

briefdescription.para: Load reduced model from another model, specifyng only the desired joints in the model.

detaileddescription.para: All other joints will be considered to be fixed to their default position, and their child links will be lumped together.

simplesect.para: the order of the degreese of freedom of the newly loaded model will be the one specified by the input joints serialization, i.e. consideredJoints

parameterdescription.para: path to the file to load.
list of joints to consider in the model.
map between the dof name of the dof no in consideredJoints and their (fixed) position in the reduced model
(optional) explicit definition of the type of the loaded file. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.

simplesect.para: true if all went well (files were correctly loaded and consistent), false otherwise.
Until https://github.com/robotology/idyntree/issues/132 is fixed, this method does not accounts for sensors.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Model &fullModel, const std::vector< std::string > &consideredJoints, const std::unordered_map< std::string, double > &removedJointPositions, const std::string filetype="")
memberdef.name: loadReducedModelFromFullModel

briefdescription.para: Load reduced model from another model, specifyng only the desired joints in the model.

detaileddescription.para: All other joints will be considered to be fixed to their default position, and their child links will be lumped together.

simplesect.para: the order of the degreese of freedom of the newly loaded model will be the one specified by the input joints serialization, i.e. consideredJoints

parameterdescription.para: path to the file to load.
list of joints to consider in the model.
map between the dof name of the dof no in consideredJoints and their (fixed) position in the reduced model
(optional) explicit definition of the type of the loaded file. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.

simplesect.para: true if all went well (files were correctly loaded and consistent), false otherwise.
This overload will not work with joints with position coordinates dimension > 1. Use the std::vector<double> version for full support of all joint types.
Until https://github.com/robotology/idyntree/issues/132 is fixed, this method does not accounts for sensors.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string modelString, const std::vector< std::string > &consideredJoints, const std::unordered_map< std::string, std::vector< double >> &removedJointPositions, const std::string filetype="", const std::vector< std::string > &packageDirs={})
memberdef.name: loadReducedModelFromString

briefdescription.para: Load reduced model from string, specifyng only the desired joints in the model.

detaileddescription.para: All other joints will be considered to be fixed to their default position, and their child links will be lumped together.

parameterdescription.para: string containg the model of the robot.
list of joints to consider in the model.
map between the dof name of the dof no in consideredJoints and their (fixed) position in the reduced model
(optional) explicit definiton of the filetype to load. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.
(optional) a vector containing the different directories where to search for model meshes

simplesect.para: true if all went well (files were correctly loaded and consistent), false otherwise.
In case no package is specified ModelLoader will look for the meshes in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, ROS_PACKAGE_PATH and AMENT_PREFIX_PATH

If a given model searches for the meshes in package://StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, and the actual mesh is in /usr/local/share/StrangeModel/Nested/mesh.stl, packageDirs should contain /usr/local/share.

briefdescription.para: Load reduced model from file, specifyng only the desired joints in the model.

detaileddescription.para: All other joints will be considered to be fixed to their default position, and their child links will be lumped together.

parameterdescription.para: path to the file to load.
list of joints to consider in the model.

(optional) explicit definiton of the filetype to load. Only "urdf" is supported at the moment.
(optional) a vector containing the different directories where to search for model meshes

simplesect.para: true if all went well (files were correctly loaded and consistent), false otherwise.
This overload will not work with joints with position coordinates dimension > 1. Use the std::vector<double> version for full support of all joint types.
In case no package is specified ModelLoader will look for the meshes in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, ROS_PACKAGE_PATH and AMENT_PREFIX_PATH

briefdescription.para: Return true if the model have been correctly true.

simplesect.para: True if the model was loaded correctly.

briefdescription.para: Helper class to load a model from a generic format.

detaileddescription.para: Unless the methods for loading a model with an explicit serialization are used, the default joint serialization of the model loaded will be a "normalized" joint serialization based on the default base link, see the iDynTree::createModelWithNormalizedJointNumbering function for more details.
